brief_summary.textblock:
Emergency access granted to treat a single patient with advanced Mucopolysaccharidosis Type
      7 with UX003 Recombinant Human Beta-glucuronidase (rhGUS) Enzyme Replacement Therapy via IV
      administration every other week (QOW) for 48 weeks.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Open-Label Treatment Protocol With UX003 rhGUS Enzyme Replacement Therapy for an Advanced Stage MPS 7 Patient

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  1 specific patient

          -  Confirmed diagnosis of MPS 7 based on leukocyte or fibroblast glucuronidase enzyme
             assay or genetic testing confirming diagnosis.

          -  Written informed consent of parent(s) or legal guardian(s)

clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Treatment Protocol With UX003 Recombinant Human Beta-glucuronidase (rhGUS) Enzyme Replacement Therapy for an Advanced Stage Mucopolysaccharidosis Type 7 (MPS 7) Patient

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: North Shore Long Island Jewish Health System
responsible_party.investigator_title: Chief of Medical Genetics at Cohen Children's Medical Center

clinical_study.source: North Shore Long Island Jewish Health System
